content:
I see we now have 50 iron plates in our inventory! Let's use these to craft some automation components:

```python
# Check what we can craft with our iron plates
print(f"Starting inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Let's craft some basic automation components
# First, try crafting an inserter
recipe = get_prototype_recipe(Prototype.BurnerInserter)
print(f"Burner inserter recipe: {recipe}")
craft_item(Prototype.BurnerInserter)

# Then craft some transport belts
recipe = get_prototype_recipe(Prototype.TransportBelt)
print(f"Transport belt recipe: {recipe}")
craft_item(Prototype.TransportBelt, quantity=10)

# Get our mining drill position
drill = get_entities({Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill})[0]
print(f"Mining drill position: {drill.position}, drop position: {drill.drop_position}")

# Place an inserter near the mining drill
inserter_pos = Position(x=drill.position.x, y=drill.position.y + 1)
move_to(inserter_pos)
inserter = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, position=inserter_pos)

# Add fuel to the inserter
if inserter:
    insert_item(Prototype.Coal, inserter, quantity=5)

# Place transport belt from the inserter
belt_pos = Position(x=inserter_pos.x, y=inserter_pos.y + 1)
move_to(belt_pos)
place_entity(Prototype.TransportBelt, position=belt_pos)

print(f"Final inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Final entities: {get_entities()}")
```

This should help automate our iron ore collection by:
1. Using an inserter to pick up ore from the mining drill
2. Placing it onto a transport belt
3. Moving it towards our furnaces

Let me know if this works or if we need to adjust the positioning of the automation components.
